notes: Johnny's Selected Seeds provides days to maturity from transplant date rather than zone-specific planting calendars. For zone-specific timing, they recommend using their Seed Starting Date Calculator based on local last frost dates. Zone recommendations were limited or not specified on most product pages.

cultivars.description: Famously rich flavor and texture. Unusual variety with full flavor.

zoneRecommendations.note: Standard warm-season tomato. Start indoors 5-6 weeks before transplant date.

cultivars.description: Sweet and robust. Round, 20 gm fruits regarded as one of the best-tasting tomatoes.

zoneRecommendations.note: Cherry tomato suitable for field, greenhouse, or backyard garden

cultivars.description: The wild tomato with great flavor.
One of the most flavorful tomatoes. Luscious, heirloom flavor as very rich, loud, and distinctively spicy. Large fruits often exceed 1 lb.

zoneRecommendations.note: Classic indeterminate heirloom. Best staked or caged.

cultivars.description: Early Brandywine type. Large slicing tomato with traditional heirloom qualities.

zoneRecommendations.note: Suitable for warm-season growing. Start seeds indoors 6-8 weeks before last frost.

cultivars.description: Exceptionally sweet, bright tangerine-orange cherry tomatoes. Intense fruity flavor.
Extra-early, highly productive standard. Huge yields of medium-size, 3-4 lobed fruits.

zoneRecommendations.note: Warm-season crop. Will not thrive below 60°F. Start indoors 8 weeks before transplant.

cultivars.description: Famous Spanish heirloom. About 1 out of 20 fruits will be hot, the rest mild. All fruits become hot if allowed to grow 2-3 inches long.

zoneRecommendations.note: Standard pepper transplanting. Start indoors 6-8 weeks before last frost.

cultivars.description: Open-pollinated jalapeño variety with early maturity.

zoneRecommendations.note: Very little fruit set above 90°F. Sow seed about 8 weeks prior to transplanting.

cultivars.description: Personal-size melon variety described as widely adapted.

zoneRecommendations.note: Widely adapted. Add about 10 days to maturity if direct-seeded.

cultivars.description: Disease-tolerant and shippable. Melons resist cracking at maturity with sturdy rinds.

zoneRecommendations.note: Standard melon growing. Add 10 days if direct-seeded.

cultivars.description: Classic large watermelon with excellent flavor and texture. Dark and light yellow-green striped, 10 x 12 inch blocky oval fruits weighing 15-25 lb. Crisp, sweet pink flesh.

zoneRecommendations.note: Add about 10 days to maturity if direct-seeded vs transplant.

cultivars.daysToMaturity: begins fruiting second year after planting
cultivars.description: Day-neutral variety, productive for Southern growers. High productivity, disease resistance, and large delicious fruit. Low chill requirement makes it ideal for growers in warmer climates.

zoneRecommendations.note: Low chill requirement ideal for warmer climates. Specifically noted as productive for Southern growers.

8.note: Suitable for warm climate growing with low chill requirement

9.note: Suitable for warm climate growing with low chill requirement

10.note: Suitable for warm climate growing with low chill requirement

cultivars.daysToMaturity: flowers and fruits all season; midsummer through October in North
cultivars.description: Day-neutral variety with large, prolific berries. Flowers and fruits all season.

zoneRecommendations.note: In the North, plants will set fruit from midsummer through October.

cultivars.daysToMaturity: harvest begins second spring and for 3-5 years thereafter
cultivars.description: Yields medium-size, dark red berries with excellent flavor.

zoneRecommendations.note: Summer-bearing variety. Harvest begins second spring after planting.

limitations.zoneSpecificTiming: Johnny's Selected Seeds does not provide zone-specific planting calendars on product pages. They focus on days to maturity from transplant or seeding date.
limitations.calculatorRequired: For zone-specific timing, Johnny's recommends using their Seed Starting Date Calculator based on local last frost dates: https://www.johnnyseeds.com/growers-library/seed-planting-schedule-calculator.html
limitations.floridaGuidance: Limited Florida-specific guidance. General notes indicate peppers struggle above 90°F fruit set, and several varieties (San Andreas strawberry) are noted as suitable for warm climates.

tomatoes.transplant: After last frost when soil warms

peppers.temperatureMaximum: Very little fruit set above 90°F (especially bell peppers)

melons.daysToMaturityNote: Most varieties measured from transplant date. Add about 10 days if direct-seeded.
melons.succession: Multiple plantings more effective than relying on staggered maturity dates

strawberries.dayNeutral: Fruit through summer months during first year
strawberries.juneBearing: Harvest begins second spring after planting and continues 3-5 years
